definition[0]: if you have a fringe, your hair is cut so that it hangs down over your forehead
example[0]: a tall girl with straight brown hair and a fringe
definition[1]: a decorative edge of hanging threads on a curtain, piece of clothing etc
definition[2]: to be around the edge of something
example[1]: A line of trees fringed the pool.
definition[3]: the theatre productions in the Edinburgh Festival which are not part of the official programme
example[3]: a comedian who was a great success at the Fringe
definition[4]: relating to something that is in addition to the main or most important part of something
example[4]: The company is a fringe player in the US with less than 2% of the car market.
example[5]: We were spending a lot of money on the fringe areas that werenâ€™t producing results.
